data.title: Lots of "old" shops and very nice people.
data.text: If you love antiques, this is the place to go. Lots of old time shops.  Ice cream parlors, old time hamburgers.  Loved it

data.title: Million Light Display
data.text: Having lived in the area for 60+ years, sometimes I feel we take for granted the things of note right in our backyard. However, it is never so during the season between Thanksgiving and New Year's when a drive through the Glendale Historic District and Caitlin Court. We never miss it...It's beyond wondrous to drive down Glendale Ave., east of 59th Ave and see the million dollars worth of Christmas lights. Year by year we see additions to the display and it becomes more and more spectacular with all the palm tree trunks covered with lights of all colors, flashing lights, running lights, you can hardly take it all in...This in the park area. There are various forms of entertainment in this park, in the bandshell are kids tapdancing, bands playing, someone giving announcements, Plan to spend some time there. Try to leave time to take a slow drive up and down each north/south street north of Glendale Ave. You will see horse and carriage rides you can ride for a fee snuggled under blankets as it usually gets quite cold at that time of year, late at night. It's not Central Park, but it's nearby where we live. The streets off Glendale are lined with palm trees, all dressed with beautiful outlining lights, the organization of them is breathtaking. There are many restaurants, fancy and casual where you can have fine dining down to a piece of fudge in a cart in the park some weekends. I won't try to name the restaurants, except the one we make reservations for weekend dining and that is The Spicery on the corner of 59th Ave and Palmaire. Beautiful, good food in a home over 100 yrs. old. Some nights you can even soar in a hot air balloon, well not very high but you can experience being inside the basket of an actual, for real one. A highlight for our family every year is to have pictures taken in front of the huge and always different but always incredible Christmas tree. It is beside the Municipal building and no parking, or even driving by so you have to be creative in finding a place to park then walk to it, but it's worth the sight. DON'T miss Christmas downtown Glendale!!!

data.title: Nice place to visit
data.text: OK, now everything depends on your expectations. It is a nice preserved old city center, as you can see in a lot of places in USA and Canada, like Colorado Springs and some cities in California or many other places. It has its own charm and there are things that are making it different from others. Some of it is the Arizonian own. It has shops with antiques it has other kind of small stores, it is nice to take a walk, or to go window shopping

data.title: First visit
data.text: Thought the area would be more specialty shops, but was really just antiques and used stuff. Some low end art stuff. Not what I was expecting. We caught an Uber there, walked around for 20 min went in to 2 shops and left.

data.title: Holiday Delight!
data.text: When in Glendale, AZ you must visit the historic district by the municipal complex. Lots of interesting things to see. If you are there during the fall holidays, be sure and visit their colorful holiday display.

data.title: A Great History Lesson
data.text: A great throwback to earlier times in Glendale. Do it on foot to see things you may miss otherwise.  Fall is the best time to experience this little known district

data.title: lots of boutiques and good food
data.text:
This is a quaint small town feeling area in a big town. There are plenty of antique shops, boutique's and nice little cafe's or if your looking for cookies and tea look for a place called Coyote Oatie 7005 N 58th Ave. 
I am fortunate to live in Glendale and enjoy the year round events held in the park here. Like the Chocolate love affair in February, the music festival in June and Glendale Glitters in Nov, Dec, Jan. Be sure not to Miss the Famous Cerreta Candy factory 5345 W Glendale Ave. Glendale, AZ 85301and ask for a free sample, French mint is my favorite.

data.title: Great shopping and great food!
data.text: This is a little jewel in downtown Glendale!  Great shops to check out!  If you love antiquing definitely check it out.  There are also quite a few delicious restaurants!  Make an afternoon of it!  Well worth it!

data.title: It's a fun little area to walk around and visit some antique shops.
data.text: There are special venues here throughout the year. Cerreta's chocolates and Haus Murphys are my personal food stops! Haven't eaten in the Spicery for a few years....need to revisit that. Please don't force your guys to eat here unless you're confident they won't knock anything over and know how to balance a napkin on their lap😄 It is a tea room after all!

data.title: Antiques Galore and Good Food!
data.text: Lots of walking and plenty of nice shops and eateries to see.  This is fun when it's not 110+ in AZ.  Not in the best area.

data.title: Charming Historic District
data.text:
Charming area with great antique stores and novelty shops.  Live performances on the square in Fall/Winter/Spring seasons are really fun for all.  Christmas parade and festival activities are a must.  Reasonable parking in lots and on-street nearby.

Plenty places to eat and potty for old and young.

data.title: Browsing
data.text: Several little quirky shops w/ items not found elsewhere. Good variety eateries. Park decorated nicely for holidays.

data.title: Great local spot.
data.text: Glendale offers an array of mundane outings, including the nearby Westgate Center.  However, Old Town Glendale is a lot like Old Time Scottsdale.  Lots of personalised restaurants, shops and antique establishments.  A great and rare find near the stadium.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Great place to shop and eat!  They always seem to have something going on especially around the holidays.  Fun to do things for family and friends.  With they would spread it out a little better do it isn't so crowded and packed.  Glendale glitters and the chocolate festival are my favorite.  But I also love the antique stores and little restaurants.

data.title: Downtown Glendale puts on some fun events throughout the year.
data.text: From the Chocolate Affaire, Glendale Glitters and Glows, and the Winter Wonderland are fun events for dates with my husband or family events with our children.

data.title: Little Shops of Fun!
data.text: This area of Glendale is full of little shops located in old historic homes of the area.  It's especially fun for a group of women to have lunch at The Spicery and then walk around perusing the shops.

data.title: A walk thru the past
data.text: Many of the shops are antique dealers with unique shops in and around the downtown and historic districts. Also a handful of small dining venues scattered throughout the area.

data.title: beautiful area, nice shops
data.text: great place to hang out with the girls, nice shopping, good reestaurants. visit cerretas candy or have lunch at the spicery

data.title: Love all the shops
data.text: Fun to visit. The antique shops are fun to browse through. Good restaurants and tea places. May activities that goon throughout the year.

data.title: Something different on a Sunday afternoon.
data.text: Except nothing is open. On Sunday...as many of the smaller antique places had their doors shuttered. Need to go when their is an event. We got lucky and were entertained by a street fair.
